definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: I confess, gestational surrogacy is a topic that I have steered clear of until now.
sentences.chinese: 老实说，代孕的话题到现在都令我避讳。

sentences.english: Birth by surrogate mothers, it could turn out to be an issue for anybody," he told the news conference in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 通过代孕母亲生产可能会成为任何一个人面临的问题。

sentences.english: Middle-aged man has exultant description of "surrogate" in its benefits.
sentences.chinese: 中年男子眉飞色舞地介绍起了“代孕”的种种好处。

sentences.english: Japanese obstetricians adopted a ban against surrogate births in 1983.
sentences.chinese: 1983年日本产科界通过了一项禁止代孕的规定。

sentences.english: The resulting embryo was then transferred into a surrogate dog mother.
sentences.chinese: 然后将产生的胚胎转移到一个代孕狗妈妈。

sentences.english: Are you interested in learning more about gestational surrogacy?
sentences.chinese: 关于代孕，你还想了解更多吗？

sentences.english: Surrogate shall be artificially inseminated with the semen of Natural Father by a physician.
sentences.chinese: 代孕妈妈将由医生用生父的精子进行人工受精。

sentences.english: However, in reality, despite being banned surrogate is still a lot there.
sentences.chinese: 然而，现实中的代孕却是禁而不止仍然大量存在的。

definition: to bear/to give birth/to grow/to rear/to bring up (children)/fertility
sham marriage, esp. a marriage between a gay man and a lesbian arranged in response to parental expectations of a conventional marriage/abbr. for 形式婚姻
